Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a pale-orange pottery vessel, the interior is slightly grooved, the exterior is covered with a cream-coloured slip and remains of five lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393263) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393263)
